title: Champion Bans
body: Would it be possible to make it so if you declare a champion your team can no longer ban it? I have just been in three champ selects where the same guy would ban peoples champions making them quit the queue, and he would just put a ":)" when asked why he did it. It's trolling but you guys don't realize that they're doing it.

replies.body:
Ill admit to banning champs from my own team.
I never do it to troll or to spite them.

I did it when the whole brand support fad was a thing, in ranked, I see the support hovering over brand, RIP brand.

And now that we have 10 bans, I ban Lee Sin every game regardless.
So much of this game is going to shit, I'm not going to spend whats still good about it playing against a Lee.  and I consider it my civic duty to ban him from my team too, so the other team can still enjoy themselves.
I've seen very little of Lee Sin since pre-season started.

I ban Yasuo nearly 90% of my games, the other 10% is depending on my mood.
I don't want to see Yasuo in the game, at all, as in I want him deleted.

I don't care if someone on my team wants to play him, they'll just feed like they always do.
And if the enemy gets it whoever is laning against the Yasuo will feed, like they always do.

I can gank as much as I want, going 19/0/10 on Hecarim/Rengar/whatever and yet the 0/20/0 Yasuo that I specifically murderfucked will turn around and go 20/20/0 for no fucking reason other than finally getting 100% crit.

Yes I can win against this still, but I don't want to put in the effort.

I don't care if you are on my team and want to play the champion I've already decided to ban before the champ select even takes place.

Nope.

You can't just hover a champion and have it be not bannable, there are reasons to ban a champion regardless of if it's hovered or not.

Fact is, i don't want to try and wait for a last pick to pick a champion, when your basically handing the champion to the other team.

Fact is it's not trolling, you don't HAVE to get the champion you want.

But it's not handing it to the other team? It's about teamwork, and banning a champion your teammate has blatantly said he wants to play, is not working as a team. It automatically sets a bad vibe for the game. Obviously you don't HAVE to play the champion you want to, good observation genius, but if you're declaring it you obviously have the intent of playing said champ. So why ban it if your teammate wants to play it?

IT DOESN'T MATTER, JUST BECAUSE THEY WANT TO PLAY IT, DOESN'T MEAN THEY ARE GUARANTEED TO GET IT.

EDIT: The enemy team can easily take a champion, and if that champion is a strong pick, i don't want them having it.

The one trick fucking pony's who are bad even on their own champions are generally the ones whining and dodging in these cases.
Well you can clearly see I'm not a one trick, so that's irrelevant
I've had the same problems a few times. People banning the champ I declared and then they just troll for the rest of the game.
